Dating: BYZANTINE PERIOD (not before); COPTIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Tapestry fragment
Description: This square fragment is a tapestry of undyed linen and purple, red, yellow, green and pink wool. The piece depicts the frontal view of a female bust. The face is dominated by large kohl-painted eyes with wide pupils. The woman is wearing a diadem, earrings, a necklace and a torque with a lozenge-shaped pendant. The central scene is surrounded by a cable pattern consisting of two interlocking bands and a double border. The piece dates to the seventh or eighth century and reflects a Byzantine tradition. It was probably once part of a household decoration, perhaps a hanging.
